00042 #  define MSQ_FUNCTION ""

00052 #define MSQ_CHKERR(err)  (err.error() && err.push(MSQ_FUNCTION,__FILE__,__LINE__))
00053 
00058 #define MSQ_ERRRTN(err)  if (MSQ_CHKERR(err)) return
00059 
00062 #define MSQ_ERRZERO(err)  if (MSQ_CHKERR(err)) return 0
00063 
00066 #define MSQ_ERRFALSE(err)  if (MSQ_CHKERR(err)) return false
00067 
00077 #define MSQ_SETERR(err) \
00078 Mesquite::MsqError::setter(err, MSQ_FUNCTION,__FILE__,__LINE__).set

00100 class MsqError {
00101 public:
00102 
00103     /* NOTE: If you add an error to this list, make sure
00104        a) you add it *before* LAST_ERROR_CODE
00105        b) you add the corresponding string in MsqError.cpp
00106      */
00109   enum ErrorCode {
00110     NO_ERROR          =  0,
00111     UNKNOWN_ERROR,         
00112     OUT_OF_MEMORY,         
00113     INVALID_ARG ,          
00114     NOT_INITIALIZED,       
00115     INVALID_STATE,         
00116     FILE_ACCESS,           
00117     FILE_FORMAT,           
00118     PARSE_ERROR,           
00119     IO_ERROR,              
00120     INVALID_MESH,          
00121     NO_PD_STORAGE_MODE,    
00122     NOT_IMPLEMENTED,       
00123     INTERNAL_ERROR,        
00124     INTERRUPTED,           
00125     TAG_ALREADY_EXISTS,    
00126     TAG_NOT_FOUND,         
00127     UNSUPPORTED_ELEMENT,   
00128     PARALLEL_ERROR,        
00129     BARRIER_VIOLATED,      
00130     LAST_ERROR_CODE
00131   };
00132   
00134   MESQUITE_EXPORT void clear(); 
00135   
00137   inline bool error() const       { return NO_ERROR != errorCode; }
00139   inline operator bool() const    { return NO_ERROR != errorCode; }
00140 
00142   MESQUITE_EXPORT MsqError() : errorCode(NO_ERROR) { } 
00143   
00145   MESQUITE_EXPORT virtual ~MsqError();
00146 
00147  /* ************************************************************ *
00148   *            Low-level access to error data
00149   * ************************************************************ */  
00150 
00152   inline ErrorCode error_code() const    { return errorCode; }
00153 
00156   struct MESQUITE_EXPORT Trace {
00157     std::string function;
00158     std::string file;
00159     int line;
00160     
00161     Trace( const char* fun, const char* fil, int lin )
00162      : function(fun), file(fil), line(lin) {}
00163   };
00164   
00166   MESQUITE_EXPORT const char* error_message() const;
00167   
00170   typedef std::list<Trace> StackTrace;
00171 
00173   inline const StackTrace& stack() const { return stackTrace; }
00174 
00175 
00176  /* ************************************************************ *
00177   *                        Set error data
00178   * ************************************************************ */  
00179   
00182   MESQUITE_EXPORT virtual bool push( const char* function, const char* file, int line );
00183   
00185   MESQUITE_EXPORT virtual bool set_error( ErrorCode num, const char* msg = 0 );
00186   
00190   class MESQUITE_EXPORT Setter {
00191     public:
00192       Setter(MsqError& err, const char* function, const char* file, int line) 
00193         : mErr(err), functionName(function), fileName(file), lineNumber(line) {}
00194       
00195       bool set( ErrorCode num );
00196       bool set( const char* message, ErrorCode num );
00197       bool set( const std::string& message, ErrorCode num );
00198       bool set( ErrorCode num, const char* format, ... )
00199       #ifdef __GNUC__
00200         __attribute__ ((format (printf, 3, 4)))
00201       #endif
00202         ; // ending semicolon for set( ErrorCode num, const char* format, ... )
00203     private:
00204       MsqError& mErr;
00205       const char* functionName;
00206       const char* fileName;
00207       int lineNumber;
00208   };
00209 
00210   static inline Setter setter( MsqError& err, const char* function, const char* file, int line )
00211   { return Setter( err, function, file, line ); }
00212
